PrimEcoSys: North American Warm Desert Bedrock Cliff and Outcrop

references.A86FRI01USGP: Grismer, L. L., and M. A. Galvan. 1986. A new night lizard (Xantusia henshawi) from a sandstone habitat in San Diego County, California. Trans. San Diego Soc. Nat. Hist. 21:155-165.
references.A01LOV01USGP: Lovich, R. 2001. Phylogeography of the night lizard, Xantusia henshawi, in southern California: evolution across fault zones. Herpetologica 57:470-487.
references.B02GRI01USGP: Grismer, L. L. 2002. Amphibians and reptiles of Baja California including its Pacific islands and islands in the Sea of Cortes. University of California Press, Berkeley, California.

habitat_description:
This species is restricted to the southeastern flank of the Santa Rosa Mountains and to theTruckhaven Rocks area and the Anza-Borrego Desert State Park, San Diego County, California (Grismer and Galvan 1986; Lovich 2001; Lovich and Grismer 2003).

Primary habitat locations are sandstone crevices and burrows (Lovich and Grismer 2003). Grismer and Galvan (1986) observed individuals occupying apparent rodent burrows nearby hardened siltstone.
